name: Barocco Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: What a great place to stay! The location is perfect, right on Piazza Barbarini which is convenient to all locations. Very friendly staff, great rooms (almost totally soundproof and with great A/C), and a terrific breakfast every day.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were in Italy for 2 weeks and stayed at several hotels in several cities including another hotel in Rome and this was the best. This hotel is a pearl. Great location, rooms were beautiful, staff went out of their way and the breakfast was superb. Rome was great and this is the place to stay!
reviews.title: Great Hotel
excellent
reviews.text: clean, intimate, personable, friendly, amazing are only a few of the adjectives i would use to describe the experience at Barocco, not to mention the beds are the most comfortable of any hotel, though there are many choices in Rome, (a city i frequent quite a bit) Barocco along with the affordable price, is always an easy choice for me.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were in Rome for a family/friends vacation and stayed at the Barocco for two nights. It was a great place for both the adults and teenagers! The hotel has a great location on a quiet side street that opens to a beautiful piazza. The subway is just around the corner and many of the sights you don't want to miss are within an easy walk. This was our second time to Rome and if I ever return, I would surely stay at the Barocco Hotel again! Highly recommend this wonderful boutique hotel!
reviews.title: Wonderful Rome Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I stayed 3 nights at the Barocco in Rome. This was my first trip to Italy and I was concerned about travelling from the airport to the hotel alone. Fabio arranged for a shuttle to pick me up at the airport at an affordable price. My bed was large and extremely comfortable. The buffet breakfast selection was large and also included omelette selection from a menu if preferred. Restaurant suggestions by the staff were excellent. You can't beat this hotel for location, comfort and helpful cheery staff.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed 5 nights at the Barocco Hotel. You can't get to much more centralized than where this hotel is located. It's about a 5min walk to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain was only 15min walk, Pantheon about 10-15min walk, the Colosseum was about 25 min walk, Basilica of Saint Peter was about 30mins, and many, many other spectacular historical sights with in 20min walk (give or take 5mins). The maid service was impeccable. When you leave your hotel room, you drop your room key off at the front desk. When you come back, your bed is always made, even if you took a mid day nap. Their continental breakfast was exceptional. Nothing like you find in the states. If you aren't pleased with their breakfast, then the problem is not with them, but with you. You can get eggs to order, cappuccinos, lattes, American coffee with cream, and a few other items at no additional cost during breakfast hours (7am to 10:30am if I remember correctly). There are dozens of great restaurants near by, all within easy walking distance. They hotel staff can recommend some great restaurants in the near by area as well. The hotel is extremely close (1 block) from the nearest metro station so if you plan to go a little further away from the hotel or aren't able to walk great distances, just hop the metro. They have bus stops right around the corner as well. The room was perfect for our needs. Air conditioned, mini fridge, complimentary fruit on the desk, shower, hair dryer, heated towel rack, comfy bed, ample plugins for our camera batteries, computers, etc. They have a small 17in TV in the room, a safe, and wall locker for your hanging cloths. Can't ask for much more. Upon your arrival they will provide you with a complimentary map of the area showing you all the hot spots to visit. Ask them about restaurants, and they'll mark those on the map for you as well. When my wife and I visit Italy again, if we end up in Rome (Roma), we will, without a doubt, stay at the Barocco Hotel again.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hats off to the management and staff at the Barocco Hotel in Rome. The location, cleanliness and great breakfast was a big key to our sucessful stay. Thanks for a great stay in your beautiful city.
reviews.title: Great addition for our 30th anniversary trip.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the location, the staff, the rooms, and the breakfast...all fantastic! What else could you ask for? Thanks for all of your help getting around the city and eating at the right places!
reviews.title: perfect place to stay in rome...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We are very particular in where we stay and were looking for a clean hotel that was in a good, central location with air conditioning. Upon reading so many reviews on tripadvisor it was very difficult to find one that met our standards until we found Hotel Barocco. It was clean, beautiful with marble floors and they had outstanding breakfast . The staff was very nice and very accomodating, and extremely professional. We don't have the outlook that your only sleeping there, for us it sets the tone to our vacation, especially since we are traveling with kids. We also used their service to pick us up from the airport, I recommend this when traveling with kids. I highly recommend this hotel and it is worth the money. We would definitely go again.
reviews.title: First time in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was ideally located / central to all major sights. The staff was awesome. The rooms were modern and comfortable. Finally the breakfast buffet (and breakfast menu) were excellent.
reviews.title: Great Location Married with Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Barocco from June 25 to June 29. We booked the hotel on Expedia after reading many positive reviews on TripAdvisor; we were not let down. We had a very long travel day and were hoping for a nice welcome and pleasant hotel, we were not let down. The front office staff was incredbly helpful and welcoming. We had booked in the Annex building, which we were a little worried might not be as nice as the regular building. We were more than pleased with the Annex. It was cool (which was great given it was incredibly hot in Rome that week) and we were upgraded to a huge room (room 50). The breakfast was wonderful and service unbelievable. The location is great too. We basically walked to everything with the exception of the Vatican. We would certainly stay at Hotel Barocco the next time we are in Rome!!
reviews.title: Great stay at Hotel Barocco!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I travel to Europe monthly on business, so I am well aware that European hotel rooms are smaller than American. But, despite upgrading a level, the room was the width of the bed and the night stands. Room at the foot of the bed was limited to the extent that we had to put the luggage alongside the bed or we couldn't open the door. This meant I had to crawl in from the bottom of the bed each night.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel, great location, SMALL rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: That said, the room was very nice. Comfortable bed, high quality linens, the well appointed. Bathroom was beautiful with a glass shower, tub, marble vanity, and heated towels.
reviews.title: Great Location, Service and Buffet Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: Breakfast was good, with made to order eggs, coffee and a good assortment of breads, pastries, fruits, meats and cheeses.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Don't let the entrance fool you. This is a great little hotel in a perfect location. We were fortunate enough to get Room 43 which had a private terrace overlooking Piazza Barberini.
reviews.title: The Barocco is Terrific

likes.liked: — The size of the room and the amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Rooms are very well appointed and have a great amenities package. The staff is very helpful and the location around the corner from the Via Veneto is terrific. Easy walk to the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain.
reviews.title: Great Location for a short stay in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have dinner at Ciao Bella around the corner. Expensive but excellent food and service.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We would go back to Barocco and recommend it to our friends.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel in Fantastic Location

likes.disliked: — Nothing ... it was a great experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes the location is excellent, ideal for walkers wanting to explore the streets of Rome or those who are happier to jump on the bus or the metro, but the hotel itself is certainly the business too. A good value 4 star hotel where the staff are very friendly and welcoming. The rooms are classical Italian (not modern minimalist) but clean and comfortable and adequate in size. Although there is a dining room for breakfast, there isn't a proper restaurant in the hotel - not a problem though as there are plenty of good eating places nearby. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutely awesome experience at Barocco Hotel, right off of Piazza Barberini. Proximity to almost everything in the old city (Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc) is a major plus, and the hotel is right off of a main spot for the hop on/hop off tour bus stops. There is a nice small travel agency just up the alley from the hotel, where you can make all of your other transportation arrangements while in Italy. About another block up the alley is a fabulous family owned restaurant (can't recall the name, but hotel concierge will tell you). The hotel staff was perfect; breakfast service and offerings were included and food was fantastic. The rooms, while somewhat small, were clean, fresh and well decorated. Noise was not a problem, as the hotel is very small. Proximity to a park (for runners) was a plus as well. They had fresh fruit in the room upon our arrival, which was a nice touch! Nightly turn-down service was standard. This place is a diamond in the rough and was a high point of an otherwise unremarkable visit to Rome.
reviews.title: Exceptional boutique hotel in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: First time in Rome and loved this hotel. Great location with a friendly, helpful staff. Rooms are large and clean with air conditioning. Will definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Barocco Hotel and won't be our last! We stayed for 6 nights. The hotel staff are very friendly and accomodating. The hotel is clean, bathrooms are updated and have all of the amenities like home! This hotel is a typical European style hotel, very quaint and comfortable rooms, but small. The breakfast is wonderful and had many selections. They have the best Cappuccino!!! This hotel is centrally located so you have the ability to walk to many places.
reviews.title: Love this hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 3 nights in the annex. It was very quiet and cold! Very good air conditioning which was important for us after long days in 36 degree heat! The breakfast is very good with a wide selection. The biggest perk was literally being right across the street from the metro station. We bought a Roma pass and got good use out of it solely based on the trains. If you are taking the train to get here which would be very easy and convenient, jjust make sure you have your eyes peeled as the sign is very hard to spot from the street, just says Hotel with one small door beside a cafe, the actual entrance is In the small side alley. would stay here again.
reviews.title: In the annex and perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel is directly on the Piazza Barberini. Fortunately, the room was soundproof so it was quiet. The room was extremely small, most of the room consisted of a king size bed. But, it was comfortable if cramped. There was no room for luggage except alongside the bed which made it more difficult to maneuver. The room was also very warm, even with the A/C on as high as it would go and it was only early May. I can't imagine what it would be like in the summer.
reviews.title: Unbelievably small room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I spend three nights in Barocco in late July. Overall impression is great. The hotel is in perfect location. Reception staff very professional and efficient. Rooms are nice, comfortable, larger than in other European hotels I have visited. Everything is very clean and tidy, bathroom in marble with good water pressure. AC worked fine, which was nice since it was hot in Rome. Breakfast was OK, although nothing special and not exactly what I expect in a four star hotel. I was extremely satisfied with the hotel and would certainy recommend it.
reviews.title: Extremely satisfied

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed in the Barocco for 3 nights in late June. We booked with lastminute and paid a bit extra for a classic room (vs standard room) in the Annex part of the hotel which is a group of rooms located in the fairly posh apartment block just next door to the hotel (<10 steps away). It's a nice old building with high ceilings - cooling in the very hot summer of Rome.
reviews.title: A great choice in Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As mention in previous review, entrance to the hotel is on the side street Via della Purificazione, not facing the Barberini Piaza. On arrival, we were greeted by the receptionist who sent a maid to lead us to our room and arrange a porter to deliver our suitcase very promptly.
reviews.title: A wonderful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was very clean and nicely decorated with touch of luxury - marble wall skirting, antique looking polished wooden furniture, mirror with golden frame, comfy bed (not to hard/soft), large marble bathroom with a hydro message tub. It has a view to the side street where the hotel entrance is on which I suppose is a bit more quite than those facing the square. Sound proofing is very adequate anyway. My only moan is that the aircon is a bit weak to my like but we left it on when we were out and it does the job to keep the room at a comfortable temperature. By the way, weak aircon seems to be a common issue in all the shops and restuarants.
reviews.title: Excellent stay
One of my favoite hotel stays
reviews.text: The staffs in the reception are always polite and helpful and certainly treat you like a welcomed guest. We were very impressed with the efficient housekeeping staffs as they meticulously clean and tidy up our room/bed every time we went out (once 3 times in a day during our stay). The good thing is that they keep a low profile and don't bother you when you are in the room, so you don't actually see them but the result of their work!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel was nice, clean and in a good location. It's near a Metro stop and within walking distance of most of the good stuff. Also the tour buses stopped right outside. Be sure to visit the Cimitero Dei Cappuccini just around the corner. It's a church with an adjacent crypt FILLED with the ancient bones of former monks. In some cases the monks are mummified and stand, wearing their robes, in archways made of skulls and femurs. It's truly bizarre.
reviews.title: I'd stay there again, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel might have been hard to find, had I not printed out a detailed description of how to find it. Plus, I asked someone.
reviews.title: Loved the Barocco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was pretty good. The front desk people were very helpful in arranging tours and transportation to the airport for me.
reviews.title: We Really Liked the Barocco Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay there again for all those reasons.
reviews.title: Barocco, Tutto Magnifico

likes.liked: — Spacious comfort and high quality of concierge service.
likes.disliked: — Internet connection, probably peculiar to the room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But, the following are a few things that might play a part in *your* decision making:
reviews.title: Not Worth the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A most fabulous experience at The Barocco Hotel, the staff were superb, the food wonderful and the suite was beatiful. the location was perfect for all the sites, plenty of buses and taxi but also easy walking distance to the wonderful places to visit. i loved the ice creams!!!
reviews.title: Fantasic time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: we took the mother and father in law here and our 5 year old there room could have been a little larger but the location was perfect we were no more then 10 minutes from the fountain, the spanish steps ,and the gardens the breakfast was ok kept the hunger pangs away till lunch (.the more reasonable priced restaurants turn left out of the hotel doors then left again theres so many small traditional ones to choose from )the staff could not have been more freindly and the hotel was spotlesly clean . we intend on going back to rome in september with our other children and no dought about it we would defenitly stay here again
reviews.title: a great hotel=great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From Liverpool England
reviews.title: Not what we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel from June 16th to 19th for our honeymoon. We have stayed in Rome before at a 3 star hotel and decided to go book a
reviews.title: Great Location in walkable city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 4 star for our honeymoon. We looked at the reviews and decided that
reviews.title: Great hotel, fantastic location

likes.liked: — Small, intimate, friendly hote. Great room.

description: Overlooking Bernini’s Triton Fountain, the Barocco is a boutique hotel with just 41 rooms (and a staff of 22!) located in an old aristocratic building in the heart of Baroque Rome. Carefully refurbished in 2010 and 2012 to offer guests superior standards of comfort and style, the Barocco has followed the example of leading international hotels, becoming 100% smoke-free.Attention to detail, absolute cleanliness, unique and highly sought-after rooms, an atmosphere from times past, and 21st-century technology, make guests’ stay at the Barocco a warm Italian experience full of magic.
